Mr. Gbagbo has refused to step down despite the internationally recognized victory of opposition leader Alassane Ouattara in November s run-off elections. Peacekeepers from UNOCI are currently protecting Mr. Alassane Ouattara and members of his new government in Abidjan`` s Golf Hotel against the already six-week blockade siege by Gbagbo loyalists. The Security Council is expected tomorrow to vote on a resolution to authorize another 2,000 peacekeepers, as well as the temporary transfer of three armed helicopters, from the UN peacekeeping mission in neighbouring Liberia. Mr. Gbagbo has demanded UNOCI`` s withdrawal which the UN has rejected.
